storyInfo: Lee the Lungmenite arrives at Shangshu and opts to stop over at Xingyu Inn for a spell. Meanwhile, Kroos and Mr. Nothing also make it to Shangshu after a rugged journey full of hardship. However, some sort of scheme appears to await them.

attributes.text: Dad, why's there a knife on the wall?
That was my constant companion when I was young and begging for food.
So why's there an empty shelf under it?
That's reserved for an old elder of mine.

attributes.content: It's early in the morning, and the weather's cloudy.
Along Yingfeng Road in Shangshu of Great Yan, sits an inn.
Not many establishments would call themselves an inn in modern Yan.
But this one has the most antique atmosphere, the finest wine and tea, and is the most cultured in all Shangshu.
Its sign is red with gold lettering.
'Xingyu.'
Ten jars of Husong, three jars of Yunliao, six jars of Guixing reserve... hmm...
attributes.name: Someone Innkeeper-esque

attributes.content: Liu, why are our numbers here so much lower than across the river?
attributes.name: Someone Innkeeper-esque

attributes.content: Don't blame me! They went crazy with banquets at the start of the month. Of course they sold more than us!
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: How much difference can a few parties make?
attributes.name: Someone Innkeeper-esque

attributes.content: Aiyo wei! You don't even know the half of it.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: You were out of Shangshu then. You don't know how ridiculous that hoo-hah was... Those two days of business could pay half a year's worth of bills, no exaggeration.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: We were beating them for months, and those two days completely sunk us. You can't keep letting them make a fool of us, Mr. Zheng.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Remember, we were here first, and were the first to do it well. If you ask me the other places should be bowing to my old man here.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Don't be fooled into loving your grandkids while you forget your son here.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: What are you even blubbering about? Since when am I your old man? I haven't even said anything.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Yeah, and it'll be all over for me once you do.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: It was just bad luck. If I were the one to meet those nobles...
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: If it's just bad luck, then where's all your good luck to balance it out?
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Gah! Nobles, nobles, where did all those nobles come from...?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: We've always relied on word of mouth from our regulars, and you won't even do ads. If we could just invite a few pretty boys and girls to...
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: (Glare) ...
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: You heard nothing. That was the wind just now.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Running a restaurant-inn depends on customers with taste and connections, true. But what do you know about who's connected and who isn't?
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: If I knew, I'd be running the inn.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Then sit tight and learn.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Anyone with eyes can discern if someone rich, powerful, stylish, and wise, that's plain as day. So why can't you?
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Erk...
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Whether you're a kung fu adventurer or a settled person, so long as you're alive you'll mingle with plenty of other people.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: So keep mingling, and you'll get a good eye for this. Knowing people, and knowing what they know, is what lets us live well.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Meanwhile, you spend all day fiddling about, and run off to the mahjong parlors every night. What kind of future do you expect when...
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Why'd you stop the lecture?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Don't you see our two guests at the door?! Why aren't you greeting them?!
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Aiyo... I completely missed them! Quick, quick, get them in! The first two customers of the day! Get them two plates of salted peanuts and a pot of chrysanthemum tea!
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Might our luck be looking up?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: We are early. Let me treat you to dinner in Mr. Liang's stead.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Take a seat! Tea will be with you in a moment!
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: I thought we'd have made a beeline for his residence.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Your 'friend' there is still a magistrate. Busy, in any case.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Busy enough to overlook a friend? Must be busy as can be.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: (Sir, sir, what do you think, then? Are these two noble-types?)
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Pah.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Don't ask, observe. You can't judge at first glance.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.text: Shangshu, where the winds blow high, and the clouds part to show off the moon.
The land was mountainous since times untold. Some would say the rugged terrain posed quite the obstacle to the nomadic city's development.
But the folk of Shangshu were loath to give up the land they'd dwelt in since antiquity, so they went to great pains to move mountains and fuse their city with the peaks.
Hence, unlike other cities, Shangshu's plates were distributed along the lines of the range, each perhaps hundreds or thousands of meters wide and utterly unique in their scenery.

How auspicious Shangshu's habitation must be that in recent years it has never once been struck by Catastrophe. Its people have built new towns in the mountains, and opened them up with ropeways and tunnels.
Furthermore, with the guidance of the Tumu Tianshi, a mountain range of particular renown was directly relocated onto the nomadic platforms, where...

attributes.content: Slow down mate, what's a Tumu... Tianshi? 'Heavenly Master of Earth and Wood'?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: You might be unaware, benefactor, but Yan has multiple bureaus of tianshi, Celestial Masters. Any student of the land even a mite accomplished at Originium Arts may apply to join, take layer upon layer of examination, and so serve the country.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Originium Arts have a dizzying array of applications, and the science of Originium is developing by the day. The tianshi of Yan are naturally classified by profession and specialty—civil engineers, for example! The artists of earth and wood indeed.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: And here I thought cool titles like that would be reserved for Casters like Leizi—y'know, ones with crazy battle prowess.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Would Leizi be that Yan official in Rhodes Island you mentioned before? My my, it may have been like that in the past, but times have changed. Now the welfare of the people comes first.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Originium technology benefits the masses, and every tianshi of Yan's Ministry of Engineering pours their life's blood into researching Originium's Arts and testing new materials.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Other countries couldn't dream of moving whole mountains onto nomadic cities, that's for sure...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Indeed. While landscapes may soothe the soul, it certainly wouldn't be worth such monumental efforts if it broke the backs and the banks of the people in the process.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Still, most of the credit belongs to the civil engineers of the tianshi who loved their home enough to put in the work. And moving mountains was easy compared to convincing the local villages and estates to agree to the project.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Yan has an old proverb. It's a land that raises its people.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: A shame I can't speak much on Originium Arts, or else I'd have the same things on my mind as one of those nomadic city architects.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Is everyone from Yan like this?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: It's these rivers and hills before us, see—
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: The limitless sights. Early springs so tranquil you can hear the snowflakes land. There's a lasting charm about it.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: If you'd lived here since the cradle too, perhaps you'd think the same way.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Maybe. Who can say?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Phew—now that's refreshing.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: 'Where the winds blow high, and the clouds part to show off the moon.' I can see how it earned that.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Within Shangshu lie the renowned 'Three Mounts and Seventeen Peaks,' and they draw plenty of tourists. Some foreign nobility even make the trip out here simply to admire them.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Presumably the common folk owe it only to the pains of crossing the land that these landmarks aren't swarmed by such visitors coming in droves.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: There's a comfy breeze up here. I was worried it'd rain and delay us from heading up the mountains today.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Quite right, benefactor. The spring breeze caresses one's cheeks, the drizzle falls finely, all silent and slick in the rain.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Been meaning to ask, actually. You're a martial artist, right? So how'd you get so... bookish?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: My master often instructed us that practicing the martial arts hardly precludes the study of culture. Indeed, the arts come both martial and cultural. To learn them well is but the duty of the modern soul.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Besides, the art of gab can be a gateway to making some money.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Benefactor, what say we visit the nearest summit on the way? I hear more people have taken to the mountains these last two years; there's been quite the hubbub.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Pass. We'll rest in the city for a day or two, wait for the sisters to meet up with us, and head on our way...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: *Sigh* Never felt so bad about missing all the scenery on the way though.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: You've always been singularly devoted, benefactor. A mind only for the objective, not a whit more. And as proof of your conscientiousness, you never take a break.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Never take breaks? Me?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: But of course!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Whatever, flattery will get you nowhere. We're not going.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Er, but you're merely taking me to the office for onboarding. Such a minor errand needn't be so urgent.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: And did I not hear Lava mention you undertook this journey intending a vacation? Surely nothing impedes you from a good tour of the scenery then?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: If only Lava were here... I'm not the only one who needs to sort out her head right now.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Benefactor Lava just happened to be tasked with a sudden commission taking her a different way—I imagine she'll pass by scenery just as fine.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: I don't think she's the type to gawp at the view. Not in a million years.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Haha, so she isn't.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: To be honest though, she wasn't always this way. Me neither, of course.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: You needn't brood, benefactor. Things change, we change. The world's affairs are inconstant.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Let's hurry on our way, then.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Found them, Miss Du.
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: You sure?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: No mistake. They came in at Zhengshan Crossing, and got to Yingfeng Road in Weichang District. He got someone reliable to come with him the whole way.
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: And the Lungmenite's carrying an antique little box on him, correct?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Yep. Clear as day.
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: If anything goes wrong, you're responsible.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: You left this to us. We won't let it go wrong.
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: Good!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Then we're paying this buccaneer a visit in place of those yellow-bellied oldies!
attributes.name: Miss Du
